verses.text: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar in front of it, and Aaron made a proclamation. He said, “Tomorrow shall be a festival to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They got up early the next day and offered burnt offerings and brought fellowship offerings. Then the people sat down to eat and to drink and got up to celebrate wildly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses: “Hurry down, because your people, whom you brought up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have quickly turned from the way which I commanded them. They have made a calf for themselves out of metal and have worshipped it. They have sacrificed to it and said, ‘This is your god, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “I have seen these people, and they certainly are a stiff-necked people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now leave me alone, so that my anger can burn hot against them, so that I may consume them and make you into a great nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses begged the Lord his God and said, “O Lord, why does your anger burn against your people, whom you have brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should the Egyptians say, ‘He brought them out for an evil purpose, to kill them in the mountains and to consume them from the face of the earth’? Turn back from your fierce anger and change your mind about inflicting disaster on your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, to whom you swore by your own self. You said to them, ‘I will multiply your seed like the stars of the sky, and I will give all this land that I have spoken about to your seed, and they shall inherit it forever.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord changed his mind about the disaster which he said he would inflict on his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses turned and went down the mountain, with the two tablets of the Testimony in his hand—tablets that were written on both sides, written on one side and on the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, engraved on the tablets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, “There is the noise of war in the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “It is not the sound of people who shout for victory; neither is it the sound of people who cry because of defeat. But I do hear the sound of people who are celebrating.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Moses came near the camp, he saw the calf and the dancing, and Moses’ anger burned. So he threw the tablets out of his hands and broke them at the foot of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the calf that they had made, burned it with fire, ground it to powder, and scattered it on the water. Then he made the people of Israel drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to Aaron, “What did these people do to you, that you have brought such a great sin on them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron said, “Do not let the anger of my lord burn. You know these people. They are set on evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so they said to me, ‘Make a god for us, who will go ahead of us, because this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I said to them, ‘Whoever has any gold, pull it off.’ So they gave it to me. I threw it into the fire and out came this calf.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses saw that the people were out of control (for Aaron had let them get so out of control that they were disgraced among their enemies),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses stood in the gate of the camp and said, “Whoever is on the Lord’s side, come to me!”
All the descendants of Levi gathered themselves together to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says, ‘Every man is to strap his sword on his thigh and go back and forth throughout the camp, from one gate of the camp to the other, and every man is to kill his brother, and every man his friend, and every man his neighbor.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites did what Moses said, and that day about three thousand men from among the people fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “Begin your service of the Lord today. Yes, because every man among you took a stand against his son and against his brother, the Lord is bestowing a blessing on you today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day Moses said to the people, “You have committed a very serious sin. Now I will go up to the Lord. Perhaps I can gain atonement for your sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses returned to the Lord and said, “Yes, this people has committed a very serious sin: They have made a god of gold for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet now, if you will, please forgive their sin—and if not, please erase me from your book, which you have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against me is the one I will erase from my book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now go, lead the people to the place about which I have spoken to you. Look, my Angel shall go ahead of you. Nevertheless, when the right day comes for me to punish, I will punish them for their sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord struck the people with a plague, because of what they had done with the calf that Aaron made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses: “Depart. Go up from here, you and the people that you have brought up out of the land of Egypt. Go up to the land about which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob: ‘I will give it to your seed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send an angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go up to a land flowing with milk and honey. But I myself will not go up among you, because you are a stiff-necked people, and I would consume you on the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people heard this bad news, they mourned, and none of them put on their jewelry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Lord had said to Moses, “Tell the people of Israel, ‘You are a stiff-necked people. If I were to go up among you for one moment, I would consume you. Therefore now take off your jewelry, while I determine what to do to you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel stripped themselves of their jewelry at Mount Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took a tent and set it up outside the camp, far away from the camp, and he called it the Tent of Meeting. Everyone who was seeking an answer from the Lord would go out to the Tent of Meeting, which was outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever Moses went out to the tent, all the people got up and stood at their tent doors and watched Moses, until he had gone into the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever Moses entered the tent, the pillar of cloud would come down and stand at the door of the tent, and the Lord would speak with Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the door of the tent, and all the people would rise up and worship, all of them at their own tent door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses face-to-face, as a man speaks to his friend. Moses would return again into the camp, but his assistant Joshua son of Nun, a young man, did not leave the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the Lord, “Look, you yourself have been telling me, ‘Lead this people up,’ but you have not let me know whom you will send with me. Yet you have said, ‘I know you by name, and you have also found favor in my sight.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now if I have found favor in your sight, please show me your ways, so that I may know you, so that I may find favor in your sight. Consider that this nation is your people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “My Presence will go with you, and I will give you rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to him, “If your Presence is not going to go with me, do not send us up from here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After all, how would people know that I have found favor in your sight, I and your people? Isn’t it in this way: that you go with us, so that we are distinguished, I and your people, from all the people who are on the face of the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “I will also do this thing that you have said, for you have found favor in my sight, and I know you by name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “Please show me your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “I will make all my goodness pass in front of you, and I will proclaim the name of the Lord in your presence. I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and I will show mercy to whom I will show mercy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “You cannot see my face, for no human may see me and live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord also said, “Look, there is a place next to me, where you shall stand on the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen that, while my glory passes by, I will put you in a crevice in the rock. I will cover you with my hand until I have passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will take away my hand, and you will see my back. But my face will not be seen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Cut out two stone tablets like the first ones. On these tablets I will write the same words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ready by morning, and come up to Mount Sinai in the morning. Present yourself to me there on top of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one may come up with you. In fact, no person is to be seen anywhere on the entire mountain. Do not even let the flocks or herds graze in front of that mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses cut out two stone tablets like the first ones. Moses got up early in the morning and went up Mount Sinai, as the Lord had commanded him, and he carried the two stone tablets in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord came down in the cloud. He took his stand there with Moses and proclaimed the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord passed by in front of him and proclaimed: “The Lord, the Lord, the compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger, and overflowing with mercy and truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: maintaining mercy for thousands, forgiving guilt and rebellion and sin. He will by no means clear the guilty. He calls their children and their children’s children to account for the guilt of the fathers, even to the third and the fourth generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses quickly bowed to the ground and worshipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “If I have now found favor in your sight, Lord, please let the Lord go along with us. Although this is a stiff-necked people, pardon our guilt and our sin, and accept us as your possession.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said,
See, I am making a covenant. In the presence of all your people I will do marvelous things such as have never been created anywhere on earth or in any nation. So all the people who are around you will see the work of the Lord. For it is an awe-inspiring thing that I will do for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Observe what I command you this day. Watch me as I drive out the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful that you do not make a treaty with the inhabitants of the land to which you are going, or it will be a trap in your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must break down their altars and smash their sacred memorial stones to pieces, and you must cut down their Asherah poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you must worship no other god. For the Lord, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not make a treaty with the inhabitants of the land, so that they can prostitute themselves to their gods and sacrifice to their gods. If you do, they will invite you to eat their sacrifices,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will invite you to take their daughters as wives for your sons, and their daughters will prostitute themselves and make your sons prostitute themselves to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make any idols for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall observe the Festival of Unleavened Bread. For seven days you are to eat bread without yeast, as I commanded you. Eat it at the time appointed in the month of Abib, because you came out of Egypt in the month of Abib.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The firstborn of every mother is mine—the firstborn from all your male livestock, the firstborn of cattle and sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The firstborn of a donkey you may redeem with a lamb, but if you do not want to redeem it, then you must break its neck. All the firstborn of your sons you must redeem. No one shall appear before me empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you must rest. Even in plowing time and in harvest time you must rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are to observe the Festival of Weeks with the first ripe produce from the wheat harvest.
Observe the Festival of Ingathering at the year’s end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times a year all your males are to appear before God the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I will drive out nations before you and expand your borders, no one will covet your land when you go up to be in the presence of the Lord, your God, three times a year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not offer leavened bread along with the blood of my sacrifices. Nothing from the sacrifice of the Festival of the Passover is to be left over until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are to bring the best of the firstfruits from your soil to the house of the Lord your God.
You shall not boil a baby goat in its mother’s milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Write these words for yourself, for these are the words with which I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was there with the Lord forty days and forty nights. He did not eat any bread or drink any water. He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the Ten Commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses came down from Mount Sinai, with the two tablets of the Testimony in his hand as he came down from the mountain, Moses did not realize that the skin of his face was shining because he had been speaking with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Aaron and all the people of Israel saw Moses, they were amazed that the skin of his face was shining, so they were afraid to come close to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses called to them, so Aaron and all the rulers of the community returned to him, and Moses spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward, all the people of Israel came close to him, and he gave them all of the commands that the Lord had spoken to him on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses was finished speaking with them, he put a veil over his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whenever Moses went in before the Lord to speak with him, he would take the veil off until he came out again. Then he would come out and tell the people of Israel what he had been commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the people of Israel saw Moses’ face, they would see that the skin of Moses’ face was shining. Then Moses would put the veil on his face again, until he went in to speak with the Lord again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses assembled the whole community of the people of Israel and told them, “These are the things which the Lord has commanded you to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On six days work may be done, but the seventh day shall be a holy day for you, a sabbath of complete rest to the Lord. Whoever does any work on that day must be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not even light a fire in any of your dwellings on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to the whole community of the people of Israel. He told them what the Lord commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From what you possess, gather a special offering for the Lord. Whoever has a willing heart, let him bring these things as the Lord’s offering: gold, silver, and bronze;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blue, purple, and scarlet material, fine linen; goats’ hair,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rams’ skins dyed red, and the hides of sea cows; acacia wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: olive oil for the Light, spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: onyx stones, and stones to be mounted on the special vest and on the chest pouch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let every skilled craftsman among you come and make everything that the Lord has commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Dwelling, its tent and its outer coverings, its clasps, its framework, its crossbars, its posts, and its socket bases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ark and its poles, the atonement seat, the special veil that hides it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table with its poles, all its vessels and accessories, and the Bread of the Presence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also the lampstand for the Light, with its utensils, its lamps, and the oil for the Light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar for incense with its poles, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense; the screen for the door at the entrance to the tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar for burnt offerings with its bronze grate, its poles, and all its utensils; the basin and its pedestal;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings for the courtyard, its posts, their socket bases, and the screen for the gate of the courtyard;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the stakes for the tent, the stakes for the courtyard, and their ropes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the finely woven garments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments for his sons, to minister in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the whole community of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then everyone whose heart moved him and everyone whose spirit was willing came back and brought offerings to the Lord for the construction of the Tent of Meeting and for all the things to be used in its services and for the holy garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came back, both men and women, all those whose hearts were willing. They brought brooches, earrings, signet rings, armlets, and all kinds of gold jewelry. Every person who came presented a wave offering of gold to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who had blue, purple, and scarlet material, fine linen, goats’ hair, rams’ skins dyed red, and hides of sea cows brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who presented an offering of silver and bronze brought it as the Lord’s special offering, and everyone who had acacia wood for any use in the project brought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the women who were skilled spun thread with their hands and brought what they had spun: the blue, the purple, and the scarlet material and the fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the women who were willing and skillful spun the goats’ hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribal leaders brought the onyx stones and the stones to be mounted on the vest and the pouch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also the spices, and the olive oil for the Light, for the anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel brought a voluntary offering to the Lord. Every man and woman whose heart was willing contributed to all the work which the Lord had commanded Moses to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the people of Israel, “See, the Lord has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and skill in all kinds of crafts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has the ability to create designs and to work in gold, silver, and bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He can cut and engrave precious stones for mounting and can carve wood. He works skillfully in all kinds of crafts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has also put into his heart the ability to teach others—both he and Oholiab son of Ahisamak, from the tribe of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has filled them with skill to work in all kinds of crafts: designing, embroidering in blue, purple, and scarlet, working with fine linen, and weaving—all kinds of workmanship and designing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses continued, “Bezalel and Oholiab shall work with every skilled man, in whom the Lord has put wisdom and understanding, who knows how to carry out all the work for completing everything for the sanctuary, according to everything that the Lord has commanded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every skilled man into whose heart the Lord had put the needed wisdom and skill, that is, everyone whose heart stirred him up to come and join in the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They received from Moses all the materials which the people of Israel had brought as a special offering for the task of completing everything for the sanctuary, and the people continued to bring voluntary offerings to Moses every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the skilled craftsmen who were performing all the work for the sanctuary came from the specific work which they were doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of them told Moses, “The people have brought more than enough to complete the work which the Lord commanded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave a command that was passed throughout the camp: “No man or woman should provide anything else for the offering for the sanctuary.” So the people were restrained from bringing more,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the material they had brought was sufficient to complete all the work, with some left over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the skilled craftsmen among the workers made the dwelling out of ten curtains made from finely woven linen and with blue, purple, and scarlet material. They decorated the curtains with cherubim, which were the work of a skillful craftsman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each panel of the curtain was forty-two feet, and the width of each panel was six feet. All the panels were the same size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One set of five curtains was connected together into one panel, and the other set of five curtains was connected together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They attached blue loops to the edge of the last panel in the first set of curtains. In the same way they attached loops to the edge of the last panel of the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made fifty loops for the edge of the first set of curtains and fifty loops for the edge of the second set of curtains. The two sets of loops lined up opposite one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made fifty gold clasps, and they connected one set of curtains to the other with the clasps, so that the tent became one connected piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made a curtain from panels of goats’ hair to serve as a tent over the dwelling. They made eleven panels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each panel was forty-five feet, and the width of each panel was six feet. The eleven panels were the same size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They connected five panels into one unit, and six panels into another unit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made fifty loops for the edge of the last curtain of one set, and fifty loops for the edge of the last curtain in the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made fifty bronze clasps and put the clasps into the loops to join the two pieces of the tent together, so that it was one unit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made another cover for the tent from rams’ skins dyed red and another cover from hides of sea cows to go above that one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made upright boards of acacia wood for the Dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each board was fifteen feet tall, and the width of each board was twenty-seven inches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were two pegs on each board to join them to one another. This is the way they made all the boards for the Dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made twenty boards for the south side of the Dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made forty socket bases of silver to go under the twenty boards—two sockets under the first board for its two pegs, and two sockets under the next board for its two pegs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the second side of the Dwelling, the north side, they made twenty boards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with forty socket bases of silver—two sockets under the first board, and two sockets under the next board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the far side of the Dwelling, the west side, they made six boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two boards for each of the back corners of the Dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These two corner boards were double on the bottom, but they both were joined at the top by one ring. Both sets were like this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether there were eight boards with silver socket bases. There were sixteen socket bases—two socket bases under each board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made crossbars of acacia wood—five for the boards on one side of the Dwelling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: five crossbars for the boards on the other side of the Dwelling, and five crossbars for the boards on the back of the Dwelling on the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The middle bar, placed halfway up the boards, passed through from one end to the other end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They overlaid the boards with gold and made gold rings to attach to them as a housing for the crossbars, and they overlaid the crossbars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made a veil of blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine woven linen, decorated with cherubim, the work of a skillful craftsman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made four posts of acacia wood overlaid with gold. The posts stood on four socket bases of silver. The hooks were made of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made a screen for the entry to the tent out of blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine woven linen, the work of an embroiderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made five posts of acacia to support the screen and overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were gold, and they cast five bronze socket bases for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. It was forty-five inches long, twenty-seven inches wide, and twenty-seven inches high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid it with pure gold on the inside and the outside, and he made a gold border around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cast four gold rings for it and placed them next to its four feet—two rings on one side of it and two rings on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made an atonement seat of pure gold, forty-five inches long and twenty-seven inches wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made two cherubim of hammered gold for the two ends of the atonement seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one cherub for one end and one cherub for the other. The cherubim on its two ends formed one piece with the atonement seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim spread their wings upward so that they covered the atonement seat with their wings, and they faced each other. The faces of the cherubim were looking inward toward the atonement seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a table of acacia wood, thirty-six inches long, eighteen inches wide, and twenty-seven inches high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid it with pure gold and made a gold border around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a three-inch rim around it. He made a gold border on its rim all the way around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made four gold rings for it and put the rings at the four corners above the four legs of the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rings were close to the border to hold the poles used to carry the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold, so that the table could be carried with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the vessels and the accessories for the table out of pure gold—its dishes, its small bowls, its larger bowls, and its pitchers to pour out drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand was made of hammered metal. Its base, its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its flowers were all formed as one piece with the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were six branches going out from its sides. Three branches of the lampstand went out from one side, and three branches of the lampstand went out from the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three cups like almond blossoms with buds and flowers were on the first branch, and three cups like almond blossoms with buds and flowers were on the branch opposite it. It was the same for all six branches that went out from the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the lampstand itself he made four cups like almond blossoms with buds and flowers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The buds under one pair of branches formed one piece with the lampstand, and the buds under the second pair of branches formed one piece with the lampstand, and the buds under the third pair of branches formed one piece with the lampstand—the same for all six branches going out of the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its buds and branches were made as one piece with it. All of it was one hammered work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made seven lamps for it. Its wick trimmers and its pans were pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was made with seventy-five pounds of pure gold, along with all these accessories.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the altar for incense. He made it of acacia wood. Its length was eighteen inches, and its width was eighteen inches. It was square, and its height was three feet. Its horns formed one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid it with pure gold, its top, all its sides, and its horns. He made a gold border around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made two gold rings to go under its border. He made them for two opposite sides. They were holders for poles with which to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the holy anointing oil and the pure incense of fragrant spices, the work of a perfume maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the altar for burnt offerings from acacia wood. It was square, seven and a half feet long and seven and a half feet wide. It was four and a half feet high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made horns on its four corners. These horns were made as one piece with the altar, and he overlaid the altar with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made all the utensils for the altar—the pails, the shovels, the basins, the meat hooks, and the fire pans—of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a grate for it, which was a latticework of bronze, and he made four bronze rings for the four corners of the latticework grate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set the grate in place below the top edge of the altar, so that the grate rested halfway down from the top of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put these poles through the rings on two sides of the altar for carrying it. He made the altar hollow. Its sides were made of boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a large bronze basin. Its pedestal also was bronze. He made it from the mirrors of the women who served at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the courtyard. For the south side of the courtyard he made hangings of fine woven linen, one hundred fifty feet long for that side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made twenty posts for it and twenty bronze socket bases for them. The hooks for the posts and the connectors were silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, for the north side there were hangings one hundred fifty feet long, with twenty posts and twenty bronze socket bases. The hooks for the posts and their connectors were silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the courtyard on the west side there were hangings seventy-five feet wide, with ten posts and ten socket bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The width of the court on the east side was seventy-five feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings on one side of the entry gate were twenty-two feet six inches wide with three posts and three socket bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the other side there were hangings twenty-two feet six inches wide with three posts and three socket bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the hangings around the court were of fine woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The socket bases for the posts were bronze. The hooks of the posts and their connectors were silver, and the overlay of the capitals on top of the posts was silver, and all the posts of the courtyard had silver bands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a screen for the entry gate of the courtyard, made of blue, purple, and scarlet material and of fine woven linen, the work of an embroiderer. It was thirty feet wide, and like the hangings of the courtyard it was seven and a half feet high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It had four posts and four bronze socket bases. The hooks of the posts and their connectors were silver, and the overlay of the capitals on top of the posts was silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the tent stakes for the Dwelling and all the stakes for the surrounding courtyard were bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the inventories of the material used for the Dwelling, that is, the Dwelling of the Testimony, as they were recorded by the Levites under the direction of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest, as Moses had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah, made all that the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him was Oholiab son of Ahisamak, from the tribe of Dan, an engraver, a skilled workman, and an embroiderer in blue, purple, and scarlet material and in fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the gold that was used for all the work of the sanctuary project (that is, the gold from the wave offering) was 29 talents and 730 shekels, measured by the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The silver received from those who were counted in the census of the community was 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, measured by the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rate was one beka a head (that is, half a shekel a head), measured by the shekel of the sanctuary. One beka was given by each man as he passed over to those who had been counted—a beka each was given by 603,550 men from twenty years old and older.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one hundred talents of silver were used for casting the sockets for the sanctuary and the sockets for the veil. One hundred sockets were made from the one hundred talents, a talent per socket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the 1,775 shekels, Bezalel made hooks for the posts, overlaid their capitals, and made connectors for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bronze from the offering was 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With this he made the sockets for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze grate for it, all the utensils for the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sockets around the courtyard, the sockets for the gate of the courtyard, all the stakes for the tent, and all the stakes around the courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the blue, purple, and scarlet material, they made finely woven garments for ministering in the Holy Place, and they made the holy garments for Aaron, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the special vest from gold and from blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They beat the gold into thin sheets and cut it into threads so that they could work it into the blue, purple, and scarlet material and into the fine linen, the work of a skilled craftsman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two shoulder straps for the top, one on each side, so that the vest could be fastened together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The decorated sash, which is attached to the vest, was made just like it: of gold, of blue, purple, and scarlet material, and of fine woven linen, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took two onyx stones and mounted them in gold settings and engraved on them the names of the sons of Israel, like the engraving on signet seals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They mounted them on the shoulder straps of the vest as memorial stones for the sons of Israel, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezalel made a folded pouch, the work of a skillful craftsman. He made it with the same workmanship as the vest. He made it of gold, and of blue, purple, and scarlet material and of fine woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was square, nine inches by nine inches when it was folded double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They mounted on it four rows of precious stones. The first row was carnelian, diamond, and jacinth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the second row agate, sapphire, and emerald;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third row beryl, jasper, and ruby;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row topaz, onyx, and turquoise. The stones were mounted in gold settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were twelve stones, corresponding to the names of the sons of Israel. Each one was like an engraved seal with the name of one of the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made braided chains of pure gold for the pouch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two gold rings for the pouch and attached the two rings to the top corners of the pouch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put the two braided gold chains into the two rings at the top corners of the pouch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other ends of the two braided chains they attached to the two settings, and then attached them to the shoulder straps on the front of the vest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two gold rings and put them on the two lower corners of the pouch, on its inside edge, which is toward the vest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two more gold rings and attached them to the two shoulder straps of the vest in the front, close to the bottom where it is joined to the sash of the vest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tied the rings of the pouch to the rings of the vest with a blue cord, so that the pouch was kept right next to the woven sash of the vest and would not swing out from the vest—just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The robe that was to be worn under the vest was the work of a weaver. It was all blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It had an opening in the middle of its top for the head. It had a woven binding around the opening, like the opening of a collar, to prevent it from tearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For its hem they made pomegranates of blue, purple, and scarlet material.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put the pomegranates around its hem with gold bells alternating with them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (a gold bell, then a pomegranate, a gold bell, then a pomegranate), all around the hem of the robe that was worn when ministering, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They wove the tunics of fine linen, the work of a weaver, for Aaron and for his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the turban and the small pointed turbans of fine linen, and the underwear was made from a special kind of finely woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sash was made of finely woven linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet material, the work of an embroiderer, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made a medallion of pure gold to serve as a crest and engraved on it (like the engravings on a seal): Holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put it on a blue cord to fasten it to the turban on the front, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way all the work on the Dwelling, that is, the Tent of Meeting, was finished. The people of Israel did everything exactly as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the Dwelling to Moses: the tent with all its furniture, its clasps, its boards, its crossbars, its posts, its socket bases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the covering of rams’ skins dyed red, the covering made from hides of sea cows, the special veil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Ark of the Testimony with its poles, the atonement seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table, all its utensils, the Bread of the Presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pure gold lampstand, its lamps (that is, the lamps to be set out in order), all its vessels and utensils, the oil for the Light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the golden altar, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, the screen for the door of the Tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the bronze altar, its bronze grate, its poles, all of its utensils, the basin and its pedestal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings of the courtyard, its posts, its sockets, the screen for the gate of the courtyard, its ropes, its stakes, all the equipment for the service of the Dwelling (that is, the Tent of Meeting),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the finely woven garments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments for his sons to minister in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel did all the work according to everything that the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses inspected all the work, and he saw that they had done it exactly as the Lord had commanded, so Moses blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day of the first month you are to raise up the Dwelling, the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put the Ark of the Testimony in it, and screen the ark with the veil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring in the table, and set in order the things that are to be on it. Bring in the lampstand, and light its lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set the golden altar for incense in front of the Ark of the Testimony, and put the screen in the doorway to the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set the altar for burnt offerings in front of the entrance of the Dwelling, the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set up the courtyard around it, and hang up the screen of the gate of the courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the anointing oil, and anoint the tent and everything that is in it. You shall make it and all its furniture holy, and it will be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anoint the altar for burnt offerings with all its utensils. Consecrate the altar, and the altar will be most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anoint the large basin and its pedestal, and consecrate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put the holy garments on Aaron, and anoint him and consecrate him, so that he may minister to me in the priest’s office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring his sons and put tunics on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anoint them, as you anointed their father, so that they may minister to me in the priest’s office. Their anointing will give them a permanent priesthood throughout their generations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did so. He did everything exactly as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so in the first month of the second year, on the first day of the month, the Dwelling was raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses raised the Dwelling. He laid out its socket bases, set up its boards, inserted its crossbars, and raised its posts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spread the tent over the Dwelling and put the cover for the tent above it, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the Testimony and put it into the ark. He set the poles in place on the ark and placed the atonement seat on top of the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought the ark into the tent. He set up the special veil to screen the Ark of the Testimony, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the table in the Tent of Meeting, on the north side of the tent, outside of the veil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set the bread in order on the table in the presence of the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the lampstand in the Tent of Meeting, opposite the table, on the south side of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lit the lamps before the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the golden altar in the Tent of Meeting in front of the veil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He burned incense of fragrant spices on it, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put up the screen for the entryway to the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set the altar of burnt offering at the door of the Dwelling, the Tent of Meeting, and offered the burnt offering and the grain offering on it, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar and put water in it, with which to wash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses, Aaron, and Aaron’s sons washed their hands and their feet there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they went into the Tent of Meeting and when they came near the altar, they washed, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He erected the courtyard around the tent and the altar and set up the screen of the gate of the courtyard. So Moses completed the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the Glory of the Lord filled the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was not able to enter the Tent of Meeting, because the cloud stayed over it, and the Glory of the Lord filled the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Throughout all their journeys, whenever the cloud was taken up from over the tent, the people of Israel would move forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the cloud was not taken up, then they would not travel until the day when it was taken up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the sight of the whole house of Israel, the cloud of the Lord was above the tent by day, and there was fire in the cloud by night, throughout all their journeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator
